properties.name: Ak-sar-ben Bridge
properties.history: Built 1888; tolls removed 1947; replaced by I-480 bridge in 1966

properties.name: Amelia Earhart Bridge (New)
properties.history: Built 2012; replacing the historic Amelia Earhart Bridge

properties.name: ASB Bridge
properties.history: Opened to traffic on December 28; 1911; upper roadway deck removed 1987

properties.name: Blanchette Bridge
properties.history: Original westbound bridge built in 1958; eastbound bridge built in 1978. Westbound bridge closed November 4th; 2012 and reopened to traffic on August 11th; 2013.

properties.name: BNSF - Bellefontaine Bridge
properties.status: Open to one track of railroad traffic
properties.history: Construction started July 4; 1892; with the first train crossing on Dec. 27; 1893

properties.name: BNSF - Missouri River Bridge (Atchison)
properties.status: Intact but closed to through rail traffic after flooding damaged rail line in 2011; swing span on west end is still in service; because locomotives wying in Atchison have to use the swing span for tail room.

properties.name: BNSF - Snowden Bridge
properties.history: Built 1914; retrofitted to also allow vehicular toll traffic in 1925

properties.name: Bob Kerrey Pedestrian Bridge
properties.history: Opened 2008 to bicycle and foot traffic only

properties.name: Chamberlain Bridge
properties.history: Built 1925 as a four-span bridge; reconstructed 1953 as a double-barreled five span bridge incorporating five spans from a bridge at Wheeler

properties.name: Chamberlain Railroad Bridge
properties.status: Open to traffic; but rarely used
properties.history: Built 1953 with the construction of Francis Case Lake; replacing an earlier 1923 bridge

properties.name: Chouteau Bridge
properties.history: Built 1887; converted into vehicular use in 1951; demolished in 2001

properties.name: Daniel Boone Bridge
properties.status: Open to traffic; old 1935 bridge has three narrow lanes.
properties.history: North / westbound bridge built 1935; rehabilitated in 1992; south / eastbound bridge built in 1991

properties.name: First Bismarck Railroad Bridge
properties.status: Orginal Whipple truss spans replaced with through Warren truss spans; reusing the original piers
properties.history: Built in 1882 under the direction of George Morison; superstructure replaced 1905

properties.name: First Boonville Railroad Bridge
properties.history: Built 1873-74 by the American Bridge Co. under W.G. Coolidge. Opened to railroad traffic Jan. 10; 1874. Rehabilitated 1883-84 by Kellogg and Maurice; of Athens; Pennsylvania.

properties.name: First Glasgow Railroad Bridge
properties.history: Built 1878-79 by Gen. William Sooy Smith; superstructure replaced in 1900

properties.name: First Hannibal Bridge
properties.history: Built 1869 under the direction of Octave Chanute; damaged by tornado in 1887; replaced 1917 by the Second Hannibal Bridge

properties.name: First Jefferson City Bridge
properties.status: Replaced by thecurrent US 54 bridge; but vestiges of south approach remain at end of Bolivar Street

properties.name: First Omaha Railroad Bridge
properties.history: Built 1873 under the direction of Grenville Dodge; damaged by tornado Aug. 25; 1877; replaced span by span during 1886-87

properties.name: Fort Benton Bridge
properties.history: Built in 1888 by Benton Bridge Co. as toll bridge. Chouteau County purchased 1896. The swing span was lost to flood 1908; and replaced with fixed span in 1921. Closed to traffic in 1963.

properties.name: Four Bears Bridge
properties.status: Replaced by modern concrete deck girder bridge

properties.name: Glasgow Bridge
properties.history: Built 1925; rehabilitated 1986; closed to traffic on August 4; 2008; for replacement of the superstructure; new bridge opened Sept. 2009

properties.name: I-70 Rocheport Bridge
properties.status: Open to four lanes of traffic

properties.name: IC - Missouri River Swing Bridge (Omaha)
properties.history: Built 1893 by Phoenix Bridge Company; second swing span built in 1908 by American Bridge Co.

properties.name: Jefferson City Bridge
properties.status: Open to traffic on a multi-lane freeway
properties.history: Original southbound bridge opened August 1955; new northbound bridge added 1991

properties.name: KCS Glasgow Bridge
properties.history: Built 1900; using piers from earlier 1879 bridge

properties.name: Leavenworth Terminal Bridge
properties.history: Built 1892-94 under the direction of George S. Morison for about $300;000; dedicated Jan. 2; 1894

properties.name: Lewis Bridge
properties.status: Replaced by a modern four-lane deck-girder bridge

properties.name: Lexington Bridge
properties.status: Replaced by modern bridge on new bypass alignment
properties.history: Opened to traffic Oct. 31; 1924; replacement bridge opened June 25; 2005

properties.name: Liberty Bridge
properties.status: Open to four lanes of divided-highway traffic
properties.history: Northbound bridge built 1949 and rehabilitated 1986; southbound bridge built 1996

properties.name: Meridian Bridge
properties.history: Built 1924; rehabilitated 1953; bypassed by Discovery Bridge in 2008

properties.name: Miami Bridge
properties.history: Built 1939; rehabilitated 1983; closed to traffic Oct. 5; 2009; channel span demolished Oct. 27; 2009

properties.name: MKT Missouri River Bridge
properties.status: Work started to replace superstructure with new truss spans; but using existing piers
properties.history: Built 1932; replacing an earlier bridge built in 1874. Abandoned in 1986.

properties.name: Nebraska City Railroad Bridge
properties.history: Built 1888 under the direction of George S. Morison

properties.name: Old Plattsmouth Railroad Bridge
properties.history: Built 1880 under the direction of George S. Morison; replaced 1903

properties.name: Old Rulo Railroad Bridge
properties.history: Built 1887 under the direction of George S. Morison; replaced 1977 by new truss spans reusing the existing piers

properties.name: Old St. Charles Bridge
properties.status: Three-quarters of company stock transferred to the St. Louis; St. Charles; and Western Electric Railway Company
properties.history: Completed 1904; closed to traffic in 1992; finally dismantled in 1997

properties.name: Old UP - Missouri River Bridge (Blair)
properties.history: Built 1883; superstructure replaced 1923-24; spans relocated to cross Wind River in Wyoming

properties.name: Pacific Short Line Bridge
properties.history: Built 1890-96; North Approach replaced 1907; Nebraska swing span electrified 1919; South approach replaced 1922; North Approach rebuilt 1929; Rails removed 1937; Iowa swing span removed 1957; Cantilevered roadways widened 1961-62; Replaced 1980

properties.name: Page Avenue Bridge
properties.history: Built in 1999 per NBI; opened December 13th; 2003.

properties.name: River's Edge Trail - Missouri River Bridge
Rulo Railroad Bridge
properties.history: Built 1887; truss sections replaced with new trusses in 1977 but retaining original piers

properties.name: Second Boonville Railroad Bridge
properties.history: Built 1894-96; replacing the first Boonville bridge; but reusing the substructure. Replaced by the third and current Boonville bridge in 1932.

properties.name: Second Hannibal Bridge
properties.history: Built 1917 to replace First Hannibal Bridge; auto deck abandoned 1956

properties.name: Second Omaha Railroad Bridge
properties.history: Built 1886-87 under the direction of George S. Morison; replaced 1916

properties.name: Sibley Railroad Bridge
properties.history: Originally built 1887-88 as a three-span Whipple through truss; later reconstructed c. 1915 with Pennsylvania through truss spans

properties.name: St. Charles Pontoon Bridge
properties.history: Construction started 1888; opened to traffic June 1; 1890; destroyed by ice in November 1890

properties.name: Tenth Street Bridge
properties.history: Built 1921 by Porter Brothers Co. of Spokane; WA

properties.name: UP Missouri River Bridge (Blair)
properties.history: Built 1924 by the American Bridge Co.

properties.name: Wabash - First Missouri River Bridge
properties.history: Built 1871; replaced 1936 by the current Wabash Bridge

properties.name: Wabash Bridge
properties.history: Built 1936; replacing an earlier 1871 through truss railroad bridge on a new alignment

properties.name: Washington Bridge
properties.history: Construction started Oct. 1934; opened to traffic April 8; 1936

properties.name: Waubonsie Bridge
properties.status: Highway bridge replaced by new bridge

properties.name: Waverly Bridge
properties.history: Built 1924-25; replacement bridge opened Aug. 25; 2004; demolished Spring 2005

properties.name: Wolf Point Bridge
properties.status: Bridge is preserved and scheduled to be used as a pedestrian bridge
properties.history: Built 1930; bypassed by new bridge in 1998

properties.name: York Bridge
properties.history: Built 1906 by the Minneapolis Steel & Machinery Co.; replaced 1982
